title: Florida's 8th House of Representatives district
text:
Florida's 8th House District elects one member of the <a href="Florida%20House%20of%20Representatives">Florida House of Representatives</a>. The district is represented by <a href="Ramon%20Alexander">Ramon Alexander</a>. The district is located in the <a href="Florida%20Panhandle">Florida Panhandle</a>, and encompasses part of the <a href="Big%20Bend%20%28Florida%29">Big Bend</a>. The district covers all of <a href="Gadsden%20County%2C%20Florida">Gadsden County</a>, as well as central <a href="Leon%20County%2C%20Florida">Leon County</a>. The largest city in the district is state capital <a href="Tallahassee%2C%20Florida">Tallahassee</a>, though this district excludes the downtown and northeastern portions of the city. As of the 2010 Census, the district's population is 156,188. This district is <a href="Majority-minority%20district">majority-minority</a>.
This district covers part of the eastern Panhandle, including the heavily <a href="African%20Americans">African-American</a> population in Gadsden County and the college population in the <a href="Tallahassee%20metropolitan%20area">Tallahassee metropolitan area</a>. As a result, it has skewed heavily <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democratic</a>, with Republicans almost never contesting it.
This district contains <a href="Florida%20A%26amp%3BM%20University">Florida A&M University</a>, <a href="Tallahassee%20Community%20College">Tallahassee Community College</a>, and a campus of <a href="Flagler%20College%20%E2%80%93%20Tallahassee%20Campus">Flagler College</a>, all located in Tallahassee. The district also contains <a href="Tallahassee%20International%20Airport">Tallahassee International Airport</a>.
<a href="James%20Harold%20Thompson">James Harold Thompson</a> served as the <a href="Speaker%20of%20the%20Florida%20House%20of%20Representatives">Speaker of the Florida House of Representatives</a> from 1984 until 1986.
